casebody.data:
Cummins v. Cummins. After injunction granted, the defendant died; and the oomplainant had not revived the suit. The proper mode of proceeding is by order that complainant revive within a specified time after service of the order or that the injunction be dissolved. After injunction granted, the defendant died, and the suit hard not been revived by the complainant. P. D. Vroom for defendant.

He cited 2 Cox Ch. Ca. 50; 4 Paige, 104.

The Court said the proper mode of proceeding on the part of the defendant would bo, to take an order that the complainant revive, within a specified time after service of a copy of the order, or that the injunction be dissolved."

Order accordingly.
